name: Iron(II) fluoride
desc: Iron(II) fluoride or ferrous fluoride is an inorganic compound with the molecular formula FeF2. It forms a tetrahydrate FeF2·4H2O that is often referred to by the same names. The anhydrous and hydrated forms are white crystalline solids.
Solubility:
insoluble in ethanol, ether;
dissolves in HF
Main hazards:
Causes severe skin burns & eye damage;
Hazardous decomposition products formed under fire conditions- Iron oxides[3]
standard state:
Except where otherwise noted, data are given for materials in their standard state (at 25 °C [77 °F], 100 kPa).
